utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!! We are so in luck! Treeger said that we could have all this cool stuff from the basement. Wait right there.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no, I’m, I’m paddling away!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow! Really?! We get all this rusty crap for free?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh-huh. This and a bunch of bubble wrap. And, some of it is not even popped!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Could we be more white trash?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How desperate am I?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Good thing Chandler’s not here, he always wins at this game.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I just told my Mom I’d cater a party for her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: How come?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because I need the money, and I thought that it’d be a great way to get rid of that last little schmidgen of self-respect.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, I think this is a good thing. I don’t think Mom would’ve hired you if she didn’t think you were good at what you do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You don’t have to stick up for her. She can’t here you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Umm, do you guys have any juice?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just pickle.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey uh, Rach, funny story. I ah, bumped into Joanna on the street yesterday.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: My boss, Joanna? Wow, that must’ve been awkward.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, no, actually she uh, asked me if I wanted to get a drink.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You ah, you didn’t say ‘Yes’ to that did you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. No!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Hello, Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, not at first.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What is she doing here?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t understand! Last time you went out with her you said she was a ‘big, dull dud.’

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I think I judged her too quickly, and this time we were able to take the relationship to the next level.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, last time I almost got fired. You must end it, you must end it now!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, come on! It’s not like this is an everyday occurrence for me! I mean usually I’m pretty much just in there by myself.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler!! Promise me, you will end it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, I promise, I’ll end it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I hope you know what I’m giving up for ya, because she’s not just the boss in your office, if you know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah-eh-eah! Oh-oh, sorry, I-I knew what he meant.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: How’s the hired help?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Doing great, the quiches are coming along.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: What’s this? Blue nail polish?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I thought it was cute.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Ahh, that’s what your Grandmother’s hands looked like when we found her.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Let me ask you a question.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why did you hire me?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, well Richard raved about the food at his party, of course you were sleeping with him. Then I heard the food at that lesbian wedding was very nice, I assume you weren’t sleeping with anybody there. Though, at least that would be something.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! Did you hear that? She hired me because she thinks I’m good.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I didn’t hear that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah, she didn’t hire me out of pity, it wasn’t so she could pick on me in front of her friends, she actually thinks I’m good.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! And hey, it’s cool if you’re a lesbian!

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: Good afternoon, are you the decision maker of the house?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uhhhh.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: Do you ah, currently own a set of encyclopedias?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! No. But ah, try the classifieds, people sell everything in there.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: Actually, I’m not buying. I’m selling. Let me ask you one question. Do your friends ever have a conversation and you just nod along even though you’re not really sure what they’re talking about?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: …I’m telling you it’s totally unconstituional.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: …I think he deserves a Nobel Prize.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Nooo!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: …it was like the Algonquin kids table.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: Excuse me, I’m sorry, you haven’t said anything for about two and a half minutes, are you at all interested?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah-well-yeah! Yeah-oh-yeah. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s weird.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Your nails.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I know, I never wear fake ones. I just did it so my Mom wouldn’t give me grief about me biting them.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, no, I meant that it’s weird that you only have nine now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God. Wait a minute, I had them put… Oh my God! It’s in the quiche! Oh My God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, don’t panic. I’m gonna go to the store, I’m gonna get you another set of nails, no one’s gonna know, and you’re gonna look great. Oh! Oh, it’s ‘cause they’re gonna eat—that’s the problem.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Honey, don’t bite your nails.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay ah, please don’t freak out. Umm, but ah, there’s a blue fingernail in one of the quiche cups, and there’s no way to know which one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And! Whoever finds it wins the prize!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I’m not freaking out.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Then why are you laughing?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: It’s nothing, it’s just that now your Father owes me five dollars.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What? You bet I’d lose a nail?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh no, don’t be silly. I just bet I’d need these.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Frozen lasagnas?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You bet that I’d screw up?! So all that stuff about hiring me because I was good was…

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: No-no-no, that was all true. This was just in case you pulled a Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You promised Dr. Weinburg, you’d never use that phrase.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh honey, come on, have a sense of humour, you’ve never been able to laugh at yourself.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s right. My Mom doesn’t have any faith in me! Oh, that’s hilarious! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: No, I have faith…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! You have lasagnas!

utterance.speaker: Oven
utterance.content: Ding!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Op, the ruined quiches are ready.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It just doesn’t…feel like we’re breaking up.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: No, we are. I’m sad.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Yes. Uh, can’t you wait until tomorrow? All right. Unbelievable!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: No, no, that was my boss. I have to go.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m getting dressed.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: When I walk outside naked people throw garbage at me.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Wait. I wanna show you something.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Just a little gag gift somebody gave me. Put your hands together.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah-ha, you’re not the boss of me. Yeah, you are! Ooh, saucy.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: I’ll be back in ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You are, you’re gonna leave me like this?

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Knowing you’re here, waiting for me I think it’s kinda exciting.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. But if you don’t come back soon, there’s pretty much nothing I can do about it!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Hi! I brought you back a macaroon!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Oh great! I’ll keep it in my butt with your nose.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s weird, she locked the door.

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Y’know why? She’s got the Christmas bonus list in there. I saw her working on it this morning.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, swear you won’t tell, but when Mark left he gave me a key to Joanna’s office. Do you wanna see the list?

utterance.speaker: Sophie
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi! How are you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello, Joanna……’s office.

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: I’m really sorry but I may be a little while longer.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How little?!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: A couple of hours, I feel awful.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, this isn’t funny! You get back here right now!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: I can’t!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why not?!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: I’m in my boss’s car!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Uh-oh, tunnel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Rachel, could I see you for a moment?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, here’s the situation. The keys to the cuffs are on the back of the door. Could you be a doll and grab them and scoot on over and unlock me? And on a totally different subject, that is a lovely pantsuit.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You promised you would break up with her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I did break up with her! She just took it really, really well!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And the fact that you were jeopardising my career never entered your mind?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It did enter my mind! But then something happened that made it, shoot right out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y'know what Chandler, you got yourself into those cuffs, you get yourself out of them.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no-no-no-no-no!! I can’t get myself right out of them! You must have me confused with the Amazing Chandler!! Come on, you have to unlock me, she could be gone for hours, and I’m cold, and

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Chandler!! All right, this is it! You never see Joanna again!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Never!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You never come into this office again!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Fine!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You give me back my Walkman!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I—never borrowed your Walkman.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, then I lost it. You buy me one!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You got it! Here we go! Come on! This is great! Ahhh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Does it hurt?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I just always see guys doing this when they get handcuffs taken off them. Hello sweet pants!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait a minute! What are you gonna tell Joanna?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: When she sees that you’re gone, she’s gonna know that I let you out, and that I was in here, and I’m gonna get fired!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’ll make something up! I’m good at lying, I actually did borrow your Walkman!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, there’s nothing to make up, she’s gonna know that I have a key to her office, I’ve got to get you locked up back the way you were!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh-ho-ho, I don’t think so!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, this is much better.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: So, here’s somebody interesting, Joey. What do you know about Van Gogh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: He cut off his ear.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m out.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: He painted that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! That’s pretty nice. I thought he cut off his ear ‘cause he sucked. What else you got in there?

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: Let’s see, ahhh… Where does the Pope live?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: In the woods. No wait-wait, that’s the joke answer.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: Actually its, Vatican City. Now ahh, what do you know about vulcanised rubber?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Spock’s birth control.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: You need these books.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This used to be your room? Wow! You must’ve been in really good shape as a kid.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh, I’m such an idiot. I can’t believe I actually thought she could change.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, who cares what your Mom thinks? So you pulled a Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh good, I’m glad that’s catching on.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No but, why does that have to be a bad thing. Just change what it means. Y'know? Go down there and prove your Mother wrong. Finish the job you were hired to do, and we’ll call that pulling a Monica.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, umm, if a kid gets straight A’s, his parents would say, "Yeah, he pulled a Monica." Y'know? Or a fireman saves a baby, and they go, "Yeah I know, he pulled a Monica." Or someone hits a homerun and the announcer says, "Yeah, that one’s outta here." Though some things don’t change.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, I’ll go down there. But, I’m not gonna serve the lasagna. I’m gonna serve something I make.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! My breasts are really strong.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chandler! Chandler, please, I have to get you locked up back the way you were, I am sooo gonna lose my job, she’s very private about her office. Now I know why.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, look, you’re in trouble either way! Okay? If she comes back and sees me locked to this instead of the chair, she’s gonna know you were in here. So you might as well just let me go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What if I clean your bathroom for a month?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It still wouldn’t be clean. All I want is my freedom.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Foot rubs for a month!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Freedom!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’ll take all of your photos and put them into photo albums!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Freedom! I want my freedom! Why won’t you here me?! Sophie, help me! Help me!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sophie sit!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! God, would you just calm down!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m gonna say this for the last time. Would you please just…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow! There’s a lot I didn’t know about vomit. In a minute.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: So, what do you say, Joey? You get the whole set of encyclopedias for twelve hundred dollars, which works out to just 50 bucks a book!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Twelve hundred dollars? You think I have $1200? I’m home in the middle of the day, and I got patio furniture in my living room. I guess there’s a few things you don’t get from book learnin’.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: Well ah, what can you swing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How about zero down and zero a month for a long, long time?

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: You don’t have, anything?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You wanna see what I got? Okay? I’ve got a baby Tootsie Roll, a movie stub, keys, a Kleenex, a rock, and an army man. Hey!

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: Okay, I-I get the picture. Uh, thanks, for your time.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And a 50. Huh, these must be Chandler’s pants.

utterance.speaker: The Salesman
utterance.content: For 50 bucks, you can get one book! What will it be? A? B? C?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I-I think I’m gonna stick with the V, I wanna see how this bad boy turns out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I ah, will buy and wrap all of your Christmas gifts.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I ah… Oh! I’ll squeeze you fresh orange juice every morning!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: With extra pulp?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: D’oh!! I’ve got it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don’t have it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I have so got it. There’s gonna be rumours about this, there’s no way to stop it. Sophie knows, Monica and Phoebe know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How do Monica and Phoebe know?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I called them. And when they ask me what I saw, I can be very generous or very stingy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Go on.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can make you a legend. I can make you this generation’s Milton Berle.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And Milton Berle has a…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, not compared to you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: They’re not even touching the lasagna!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, they love your casserole.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s hard to believe that just a little while ago this was nothing but ingredients.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Well, everyone seems to be enjoying your dish.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I thought it was… quite tasty.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So if everyone liked it, and you liked it, that would make this a success. Which would make you…

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: A bitch?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I was going for wrong, but we can use your word.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Yes, well I was wrong, and I have to say you really impressed me today.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, you might even say that she pulled a Monica. She doesn’t know we switched it.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: And the next time you cater for me, there will be nothing but ice in the freezer.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That really means a lot. Oh, and Mom, don’t bite your nails.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wh-what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No he doesn’t!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Two hours, that lasted!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So did you break up with Joanna?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, it’s good thing you got out when you did, before she blew up like that Vesuvius.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The volcano?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. And speaking of volcanoes, man are they a violent igneous rock formation.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, lava spewing, hot ash, of course some are dormant.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why are you talking about volcanoes all of the sudden?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, we can talk about something else. What do you want to talk about? Vivisection? The Vasdeferens? The Vietnam War?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh! Did anybody see that-that documentary on the Korean War?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh God, Korea is such a beautiful country.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: With such a sad history.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Could there be more Kims?

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Who’s out there?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s me! Good morning!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: Rachel, could you come in here for a moment, please?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, sure. Umm, they didn’t have poppy seed bagels, so I… Oh my word!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: I seem to have had a slight office mishap. Could you please get the key off the back of the door for me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah! Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Joanna
utterance.content: You tell your friend Chandler that we’re definately broken up this time.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.
